articles.description: India has been attracting a lot of global R&D work in the life sciences sector in the backdrop of an abundant high quality talent pool, and cost savings of over 65% to global corporations, which outsource such work to India.
articles.content: Actis, a global investor in sustainable infrastructure, is planning to invest over $700 million or nearly Rs 5,500 crore to build and develop assets under its platform focused on providing real estat… [+3606 chars]

articles.author: TNN
articles.title: 'India has 17% of global population, but contributes just 5% of emissions'
articles.description: India on Monday did not endorse the G7 statement on the Ukraine crisis that condemned Russia's actions. The G7 summit in Germany took place against the backdrop of the Ukraine conflict that has driven up energy prices while also endangering global food securi…

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Gold prices flat as rise in U.S. bond yields weighs
articles.description: The U.S. dollar struggled against its major rivals on Monday as softening inflation expectations prompted a reassessment of the prospects for aggressive interest rate hikes but volatile markets cushioned a broader decline.
articles.content:
June 28: Gold prices were nearly flat on Tuesday, as recent gains in Treasury yields prevented any significant interest in bullion.
FUNDAMENTALS
* Spot gold was last up 0.1% at $1,824.65 per ounce … [+1645 chars]

articles.author: AP
articles.title: Watch: G-7 leaders sends 'collective signal' to Russia over Ukraine
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy underscores the urgency of helping his country’s military improve its position against Russia in a video meeting with leading economic powers, who in turn pledged to support Ukraine as long as necessary. (AP)

articles.author: Dipak K Dash
articles.title: Nitin Gadkari slams 'double standards' of 'some firms'
articles.description: Union road transport minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday called out the double standards of some car manufacturers who were not providing the safety features in cars sold in India that they were giving in the same models meant for exports.

articles.author: Richa Pinto
articles.title: Building collapses in Mumbai's Kurla: What we know so far
articles.description: A four-storey building collapsed in Naik Nagar area of Kurla in Mumbai on Monday late night. As per the fire brigade officials, one person has died and nine persons have been rescued so far. At least 20 to 25 people are still feared trapped under the debris. …
articles.content:

articles.title: Maruti: Ready to quit small cars if cost turns unviable
